definition: the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: The Chinese show was magnificent. Our athletes were brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 中国的闭幕式非常恢宏壮观，我们的运动员们也优秀。

sentences.english: The 2011 shanghai tourism festival, which closed on thursday, attracted more then nine million visitor.
sentences.chinese: 周四闭幕的2011上海旅游节吸引了九百多万游客。

sentences.english: A Closing Ceremony will be held by Mandarin Class for all students and tutors.
sentences.chinese: 华文班将会在举办闭幕典礼给所有学员及教员。

sentences.english: Originally there was another parade of nations during the closing ceremonies of the Games.
sentences.chinese: 起初，在奥运会闭幕式上还有一次运动员游行。

sentences.english: There will be a handing-over and taking-over ceremony in each closing ceremony of the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 在这届奥运会闭幕式上首次举行了会旗的交接仪式，。

sentences.english: The closing ceremony is one big party.
sentences.chinese: 闭幕式也是一个大的盛会。

sentences.english: The competitors cantered into the arena to conclude the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 选手们慢跑进入竞技场，为闭幕式画上了句号。

sentences.english: Flash forward to the high-stakes climate negotiations that have just wrapped up in Bangkok.
sentences.chinese: 让我们再来谈谈刚刚闭幕的极为重要的曼谷气候谈判。

sentences.english: Today, in an auspicious and cheerful atmosphere, the Two Sessions concluded successfully.
sentences.chinese: 就在今天，两会在一片祥和欢快的气氛里圆满闭幕了。

sentences.english: The closing ceremony of the 5th East Asian Games was held Sunday evening in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 第5届东亚运动会闭幕典礼13日晚在香港举行。

sentences.english: He dismissed the meeting without a closing speech.
sentences.chinese: 他没有致闭幕词就宣布会议结束了。

sentences.english: All closing costs and pre-paids will be paid out of pocket at escrow.
sentences.chinese: 所有费用和闭幕前将自掏口袋低收入下午代管。

sentences.english: You can watch it on TV.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在电视上观看开幕式和闭幕式。

sentences.english: The 3-day Central Economic Working Conference ended at Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 为期三天的中央经济工作会议周日在北京闭幕。

sentences.english: U.S. Labor Secretary Elaine Chao will now lead the U.S. delegation to the closing ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 美国劳工部长赵小兰现将率领美国代表团参加闭幕式。

sentences.english: Li Bin, director of the National Population and Family Planning Commission of China attended the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 中国国家人口计生委主任李斌出席闭幕式。

definition: general congress/meeting of the whole committee
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
the curtain drops/the end of the show
National People's Congress and Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference
national general congress/Communist party national congress, in recent times every five years
pinyin: quan2 guo2 dai4 biao3 da4 hui4

definition: the Great Hall of the People in Beijing
